title: Woman’s Workbox With Lid, Created before 1870s
dimensions: H x W x D: 10.2 x 24.1 x 10.2 cm (4 in. x 9 1/2 in. x 4 in.)
creditline: Collection of Edward W. Nelson, 1879, Gift of Edward W. Nelson, Department of Anthropology, National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, E36240
description: Women's tool box. Men carved boxes such as this in the qasgiq or men's house. They stored small scrapers, awls, thread spools, boot sole creasers, and other sewing tools. This particular box has been finely crafted with ivory inlays incised with the circle and dot motif. 24 cm.

tombstone.epitaph: Woman’s Workbox With Lid, Created before 1870s. Carved wood, walrus-ivory inlay. Collection of Edward W. Nelson, 1879, Gift of Edward W. Nelson, Department of Anthropology, National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, E36240. 15.2012.55.
